DOC.brief_summary: Trichotillomania (TTM) or hair-pulling has been considered as part of the obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) spectrum, although treatment with OCD medications has largely been unsuccessful. Tics/Tourrettes’ Syndrome (TS) is a disorder, which appears to be related to TTM, but is treated with a different class of medications than used in OCD, namely antipsychotics such as olanzapine. This is a study of the safety and efficacy of olanzapine in the treatment of hair pulling.
DOC.brief_title: Olanzapine in the Treatment of Hair Pulling (Trichotillomania)
DOC.criteria: primary DSMIV trichotillomania; CGISeverity ≥ 4 Any other Axis I primary diagnosis; CGIS < 4; current comorbid: OCD, MDD, alcohol or substance abuse; lifetime hx of: schizophrenia, bipolar affective disorder or dementia; current pregnancy/lactation; current suicidality or homicidality; major medical problems or clinically unstable medical disease; hx of: seizures, stroke or head trauma; prior use of neuroleptics
